reviews.text: One night stay at the Grand on a Saturday night, Room was nicely appointed, spotlessly clean with lovely views over the grey North Sea. The entrance and staircase are beautiful, staff were freindly and very helpful. Our room was small but comfortable, some of our freinds had larger rooms so I don't think ours was typical. Breakfast was very good, freshly cooked to order. If I was to have a minor moan the residents lounge bar closed while there were still lots of people in, however it was 2am so I suppose I shouldn't complain.
reviews.title: Magnificent

reviews.text: Fabulous hotel, with great northern hospitality, only stayed 1 night with a groups of friends but rooms lovely, had fantastic views over the beach and out into the North Sea. Weather awful but hotel lovely and warm great breakfast and what a staircase.....
reviews.title: It was Grand at The Grand Hotel

reviews.text: Booked The Grand for a night after an evening in Tynemouth.
reviews.title: Looks good from the outside but ....

reviews.text: First impressions - the entrance and reception lived up to its name, as did the sweeping stair case and lovely views you got from the bar and restaurant.
reviews.title: Grand not so grand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: However when we arrived at our room it was a whole different storey. It was spotlessly clean but very dated in an 80s kind of way and not worth the £105 we paid for it. It was also freezing cold as someone had turned the radiator off - given it was blowing a gale with snow showers this wasn't appreciated. The view was non existent via the very small window which made the whole room dark.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: went to the grand to have dinner as we had been given a gift voucher the previous xmas, decided to make a night of it and we were not disappointed. We booked a sea view room and the view was stunning. The room was fine and good size with a king size bed, the bathroom was big and modern with tolietries. The evening meal was excellent and very good value. all in all a very good night.
reviews.title: night away
A truly "grand" Hotel - definitely recommended
reviews.text: Hotel - beautifully and thoughtfully refurbished - wonderful grand stairwell and reception area. Lovely dining area and Lounge - very grand...!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Views - fab - not more to say really. But check you have a room that faces onto the beach otherwise the views are not quite so fab.
reviews.title: weekend getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Things to do - lovely beach to walk along, lots of restaraunts and shops nearby, Tynemouth Castle - and for shopping - the Metro Centre and Eldon Square shopping area an easy metro ride away.
reviews.title: Wonderful setting with lots of history
Grand "old" hotel but very tired bedrooms and poor breakfast!
reviews.text: Rooms - we had a 2nd floor room, facing the sea front. The room was warm, cosy and very tastefully refurbed. Spectacular views. Lovely comfy chair to sit on and enjoy a bottle of wine, whilst enjoying the view. Room was so nice, we decided not to go out.
I tagged along on husband's business trip. My first visit and I really loved the island and atmosphere.
reviews.title: Gorgeous views and grounds, rooms are outdated

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand Hotel's grounds/flowers were impeccable and we had a room with a balcony overlooking the herb garden. Everything was clean but very outdated in terms of decorating. Not horrible, but just know what to expect. One slight complaint is that the toiletries were not replenished once used (we were there for 4 days).
reviews.title: A Relaxing Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For those travelers with childrem, be advised that the TV in the room is very small! Not a big deal for us but something you should know.
reviews.title: Grand Ripoff

reviews.text: Live music every night was great!
reviews.title: Still Magnificent...Front Desk Needs Improvement

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Upon checking out we noticed that I was charged for a hefty resort fee for each day, which was a surprise after paying a lot of money for the room itself (room was in husband's name and I was listed as the other occupant).
reviews.title: Truly Grand

reviews.text: We stayed here for four nights in October for a wedding. We had a standard room on the third floor looking north. The bathroom here could do with a bit of refurbishment as the tiles were cracked and would benfit from under floor heating as bathroom was often cold. The whole room was often cold also but there was a cold spell of weather. The room itself was practical and spacious.
reviews.title: Cosy hotel and good service

reviews.text: The breakfast was very good and the service as well. The hotel could do with an extra person seving as some items at the buffet went empty and at peak times it took a bit of time to get orders. With our two small children howevere they were a good help and quick to help us with food for them. We didn't eat at any other time apart from the wedding.
reviews.title: Avarage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel lift is slow, but the stairs are certainly 'grand' and wide. Parking wasn't a problem outside at the front or side of the hotel.
reviews.title: Impressive hotel, with excellent food and friendly staff
Not so Grand
reviews.text: Having just stayed at the grand hotel this weekend for a wedding.
I have very mixed reviews , location amazing , reception area's , bars and hall ways leading too bedrooms amazing.
reviews.title: Grand is what it is
It tries hard, but doesn't make it.
reviews.text: This hotel has some things going for it, but also some negatives. We stayed one night en route back to UK. It was OK for that. It was not terribly convenient for location, on the edge of the town centre with a little bit of a walk to the centre - which doesn't have much to offer. It was quiet - hardly any other guests. We booked a de luxe 'privilege' room and it was very nice - roomy with large bed, and nice, big bathroom, but no view from the window, and sparsely furnished, with only one chair. Probably would have been just as well off with a cheaper/smaller room. Reception was excellent. Dedicated, but not secure parking is just across the road. Probably would not choose it again.

My wife and I with my sister & her husband stayed one night, clean rooms , Friendly staff, excellent breakfast buffet, beautiful porch, and views, I guess we are not as worldly as some of the other characters leaving reviews, I found that you are treated as you treat other people. taxi's are a little pricey at around $20.00 for the 4 of us on a 5 min.ride to town each time & same coming back.
reviews.title: Old Hotel with a lot of character

reviews.text: With long anticipation, My family and I were very excited to finally stay at this grand hotel with the famous porch. We decided to go during the Games and Garden week. We were greeted with lackluster service. The staff at the registration desk were cold and unwelcoming. Our room was clean and adequate except for the only electrical outlet in the bathroom did not work. The porch is beautiful and very relaxing. Skip the afternoon tea service; it's pricey and nothing spectacular. The gardens were pretty simple; not what we had hoped to see. The tour guide for the garden was very unknowledgeable regarding the flowers. Definitely, listen to Bob the hotel's historian. He's a great storyteller! All in all, it is just an average overpriced hotel but entices people to come because of its history.
reviews.title: Beautiful historical hotel, disappointing service

reviews.text: The Grand Hotel is very pricey. I have stayed there several times and felt the service was not very attentive this year. We went to the lunch buffet and I heard a guest ask what a hot entree item was and the carving chef told him it was chicken. The guest said, Oh, than I am safe, I am allergic to fish. The employee was not very knowledgeable and failed to check as the item was fish. Our server was slow to remove used plates and we often returned to them still on table after going back to buffet. We tried the afternoon tea and we were disappointed that we did not receive any service checks after the food and beverages were served. We were not offered a refill on champagne or tea. The dishes sat in front of us until we left. The associate presented the bill with food and never checked back with us. This is not the fine service and attention to detail that is expected.
reviews.title: Truly Grand, but service so -so

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had never stayed here before. It was wonderful, Beautiful room and service. We cannot wait to go again. The view was so nice, looking over Lake Huron and seeing the bridge. I hated to leave this place. From friends in Michigan.
reviews.title: awesome.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: No doubt the Grand Hotel is pricey. We took advantage of a special, but it was still pricey at $300 a night (not including dinner, but including breakfast). We stayed 2 nights for our 5th anniversary. Be sure to mention a birthday or anniversary when making reservations. I did and they gave us an incredible room on the 3rd floor with a beautiful view of the lake. The hotel is gorgeous. We had dinner there one night ($70 a person) for a five course meal. Again, pricey, but very good food. For breakfast you can choose the buffet or order off a menu....also very good. After six guests are supposed to wear coats/ties or dresses. I noticed that not everyone did though. After dinner there was dancing with an orchestra. They also had a movie. ("Somewhere in Time" w/Jane Seymour and Christopher Reeves which was filmed at the hotel. I'm glad we watched it, but it really is a pretty bad movie.) I've been wanting to stay here for several years and it didn't disappoint.
reviews.title: Pricey, but if you can afford it, stay here.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed at the Grand Hotel with my fiance in early July 2007. Overall our experience was very good. I strongly suggest a room in the old wing. The room was clean and well-maintained. The bathroom and shower were very clean - a bit of a lack of hot water in the shower. Not cold, just lukewarm. All of the pre-arranged rides were on time and I found the staff to be very helpful and friendly. The location is perfect - there is a great place for pho right across the street. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

likes.liked: — Clean rooms and a helpful staff
likes.disliked: — Lack of hot water in the shower

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My experience with the "Grand" started by having to hold open the door for my fiancé as we entered, we were both carrying a lot of goods and I had to put some stuff down, but it seemed the doorman didn’t care. It was downhill from there.
reviews.title: Never Again

likes.liked: — Ummm.... the name is GRAND, my fiance scored a free travel magazine in the lobby.
likes.disliked: — Incorrect booking, poor service, poor quality for price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2005, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: At the front desk we were told we could not check in together as we were not married and that a second room was unavailable. My fiancé was told she could look for another room around town and had to be out of the Grand by 10pm. We explained to the front desk clerk that this was unacceptable and we would not be staying there. They informed us that was fine, but they would charge us for one night’s stay anyway.
reviews.title: Good hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: So we decided to put our bags in the room while we went out and looked for another hotel, as we had to pay either way. The room was not the “Deluxe Old Wing” room I had reserved, but was one of the shabby “New Wing” one’s. Besides the availability of overpriced beer and peanuts, the only difference between these “New Wing” rooms and any of the smaller family owned hotels that line the streets of HCM City is about a $60 bonus for the Grand. Now I’m sure the “Old Wing” is nice like everyone said, but good luck getting one.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.text: In the end we walked across the street to the Me Linh Hotel, where we were treated nicely and saved a lot of money.
reviews.title: Outstanding City Centre Property

reviews.text: This is a very special place with excellent service by staff that is very interested in helping out the guests.
reviews.title: Even in the rain it was amazing.....excellent facility....one of a kind!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I highly recommend this place, the magnificent grounds and the beautiful grounds. This place oozes a very upscale experience. No it is not cheap, but you get what you pay for.
reviews.title: Fabulous - a stately ship on land

reviews.text: This is definitely a must stay facility. It is the largest Summer hotel in the world and has the best service I have experienced in years and I stay at a lot of expensive properties worldwide.
reviews.title: ok, but not a true 5 star property... way overpriced too

reviews.text: My husband and I didn't know what to expect and were absolutely delighted! The Island of course is charming - whose heart wouldn't melt at a place where the horse and carriage hold sway - but the highlight was definitely the Grand Hotel...from the iconic sweeping veranda and the ice cream bar out there to the buffets and dinner and the magnificent room. If you're expecting a Chicago state-of-the-art hotel you'll be disappointed, but if you want quietude and charm and old world elegance, you'll love it!
reviews.title: A unique experience

reviews.text: I just stayed at the Grand hotel for a 2 night stay with a group of 4 adults and 6 young children... the hotel is indeed impressive when you view it from the outside. The problems start as soon as you check in and start trying to figure out what to do. It is not kid friendly. There is no lifeguard in the large and cold outdoor pool. The TV sets in the rooms are tiny ... 9-11 inches ... no joke ... no dvd players either. The food takes a long time to arrive, and is gourmet style.... kids just cannot wait for that long..... also our rooms were small even at $ 750 per night... the beds were tiny...
reviews.title: Preoccupied with the past, inattentive to the present

reviews.text: We have stayed numerous times at Grand Hotel on business trips (Mackinac is a popular conference destination in Michigan). This summer we stayed for the first time with our toddler (under 2 years old). It was AMAZAING! We were shocked at how family friendly the hotel was. Our little girl was treated like a princess by every member of the staff - the main dining room staff was the most attentive, friendly and accomodating. Without doubt, the dinners were the most enjoyable and memorable we have had with a toddler. On our second dinner, a woman come up to us and said, "I was hoping we would be seated near you again. We so enjoyed watching your daughter dance last night." Our daughter was able to run through the parlor, run up and down the porch, up and down the stairs, up and down the halls, etc. She had such a great time and we had a great time watching her be a kid and enjoyed staying in a hotel that welcomed little ones...
reviews.title: Family Friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had such a great time that we will make an extra trip to Grand Hotel annually with our family and not just for business.
reviews.title: Second Stay even more wonderful than the first!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Grand Hotel is a memorable trip back in time and a wonderful vacation experience. This trip was no exception. Again we found ourselves immersed in the atmosphere and enjoying every moment of it...from the endless hallways, each worthy of a tour just to see the endless array of beautiful carpets...to the wonderful 100 + year slanted stairways to the incredible porch. The decorating is an amazing burst of color and pattern...the parlor is so beautiful. I been to many hotels and never walked around taking pictures of carpeting and furnishings, until Grand Hotel.
reviews.title: Too much money for a Motel 6 quality room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was again wonderful...and again as we toured the hallways every day we peeked in each room being made up and were again assured that we would love any room we were given. Service was immpecable as always....from housekeeping to the dining room...from the doorman to the servers at high tea...we were always treated well and with great efficiency, even though it was the "off season".
reviews.title: A Grand Experience

reviews.text: I find it hard to believe, but the food was even more amazing on this trip. The starters were very unique...saki & tangerine shrimp was my favorite, salad combinations were astonishing, soups superb...especially the cold soups...very flavorful. You could taste all of the fresh herbs picked below our balconey each morning. My favorite was the lavender in my brocollini. Main courses were perfection. My favorite was the halibut with calamari bolognese. When I mention to my waiter how wonderful it was he brought me an additional dish full of it. I was in heaven.
reviews.title: Outstanding Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here for 3 nights in August, our first trip to Vietnam. The Grand is well located for the sights and we found the staff to be helpful when needed. Our room was unfortunately not in the Old Wing but even so was quite large with a good sized bathroom. The bathroom was perfectly serviceable, if a little dated, and toiletries were provided and replaced whenever needed. We also had fruit in our room the day we arrived and this too was replenished daily. The breakfast buffet was fine with a choice of western or Asian dishes. We didn't eat in the hotel in the evening, preferring to eat in local restaurants. (Restaurant 13 opposite the doors to the hotel restaurant, was very good and excellent value for money). Be sure too to try a bowl of Pho while in HCMC - noodle soup which is very filling. We went to Pho 24 and had a bowl of pho each, 3 Tiger beers and cashew nuts which I thought were complimentary with the beer, but weren't! and the whole bill came to £2.47!! Saigon is an amazing city. We were told that there are 2m mopeds there and we think we must have seen every one of them! Crossing the road was an experience, but we survived intact. There are tourist police in green uniforms who will help you if you get lost or will just escort you across the road if your courage fails you!
reviews.title: Good value for money

reviews.text: Overall our stay at The Grand was good, and if we return to Saigon we would stay there again, although I really would like to try one of the rooms in the Old Wing, just to say I have done it...
reviews.title: Old charm
Charming Old World Hotel
reviews.text: We felt the hotel represented good value for money and would recommend it.

Take the modest price in consideration and you can only be satisfied with this hotel. The location is excellent. You can reach down town with all the main sights by foot. Important is that you book the old wing. This brings you back to the early 20th century colonial atmosphere. The swimmingpool is excellent for a hotel that is in the centre of a city. Breakfast also more then ok !
reviews.title: Friendly staff and lovely rooms
Not so Grand after all.....
reviews.text: Overall: a very good place to stay and explore the city.

We recently attended an Xmas party night at The Grand Hotel. It was a works night out and there was aproximately 25 of us. We were welcomed into a bar/drawing room area for a drink before the meal, the room was fab, very stylish and impressive! We went up the swishing staircase into a lovely room where our meal and party night was to be held. The tables were set and the Christmas tunes were playing, there was a bar in an offshoot room. At 8pm as advertised our meal was served, all 3 courses were really good (we have done other hotel Xmas nights and couldn't say the same!). There was organised party games after the food to get us all on our feet and it got the party started quicker than you often find at these events. There was paper on the table for us to write any song requests we wanted playing and a fun quiz about the local area which got us all thinking! We all agreed that the night was perfect and we would d efinately go again next year. The staff were at hand and very friendly giving us loads of attention!
reviews.title: A lovely setting for a fab party night!!

reviews.text: We Stayed at the Grand , Dec 7th for 3 nights, we were with Friends one of whom had seen the Grand as a child and longed to stay there.
reviews.title: Stunning View

reviews.text: We had room 328, and when we got into the room , Wow, what a view , we had the best sea view
reviews.title: Nice Sunday Lunch

reviews.text: ever, the room was large, with georgeous Window seats, the Bathroom was stunning too, with the old fashioned pull chain , we just loved it all .
reviews.title: GRAND TIME

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant served lovely food and the breakfast was superb , and if you wanted to have a different combination of things , not a problem, our waitress for all of our stay was Abby , and she was a star, so cheerful and nothing too much trouble.
reviews.title: Two night stay
Erm...Old Wing rooms great, but expensive...and stay away from massage
reviews.text: For the price (we paid list of US$130/night for an old wing deluxe room), the Grand is someplace that I don't think I'd stay again. I think there must be better-value options in HCMC without breaking the bank. And, I would say that this is not a four-star hotel as claimed....more like three.

My husband and I decided to stay at the Grand because of its apparent colonial charm, central location, and the option of the old wing rooms...were there a total of three nights in June 2007, and were in two separate rooms because we were away on an overnight trip after the first night.
reviews.title: Not so Grand`

reviews.text: The Old Wing deluxe rooms were, in both cases we saw, very nice. The furnishings are definitely charming, hardwood floors, high ceilings, old-fashioned windows, and large bathrooms. Showers just OK. The breakfast buffet included in the room price was average or below for a "four-star" hotel in Vietnam...everything was there but quality was lacking (orange juice = Tang). The New Wing building was shabby and though we did not see rooms I am POSITIVE that they are not worth the money (only $20 or so less than the old wing) -- if you must stay here, no question that it must be the Old Wing.
reviews.title: More a 3star than 4star

likes.disliked: — a/c control, breakfast buffet needs improvement

reviews.title: disappointed
reviews.text: Pool was large and nice but pool area a little shabby...weird outdoor exercise equipment in an old bar area. The facilities in general seemed a little worn down...I felt the whole place was stuck in the 80s (neon, mirrors, etc.) This took away somewhat from the otherwise nicely restored colonial building...the management should just embrace the building style and take the whole thing in a Raffles-esque direction, decor-wise...would suit the property better and make the whole place nicer.

And now, as for the title of my review...I know that we were in Saigon, and I know that there are "extras" on offer in many places. But at a supposed four-star hotel, I did NOT expect the massages to be ... so sketchy. The fact that an hour massage was US$8 should have tipped me off, but when my husband and I got to the massage room (near the pool), it soon became apparent that this was not a luxury spa...and was something quite different. The rooms were small, NO ROBES (we had to each undress IN FRONT OF the masseuse, no shades on windows from room to hallway, VERY unprofesional); massages given with baby oil by women in heels and miniskirts....railings on ceiling so that the women can WALK on your back...and finally....my husband was offered something "extra" that is decidedly NOT on the printed menu, which he politely declined. We left feeling a bit grossed out by the whole experience, not to mention that the massages themselves were terrible. Just not something I would expect from a property that is supposed to be above-board. Very uncomfortable and sullied the experience for us.
reviews.title: The Grand lived up to its name

likes.liked: — The spaciousness of the rooms and very comfortable beds
likes.disliked: — Would have liked more help at the tour desk

reviews.text: Had a great stay at the Grand Hotel. We stayed for 5 nights and had a twin and a triple as there were 5 ladies travelling together. Staff were helpful and friendly. Beds comfortable. Breakfast good. Construction noise across the road a bit annoying but this was not the hotels fault. Would not hesitate to stay here again.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: We stayed 4 nights in October 2007 as part of a 12-day tour of Vietnam.
reviews.title: Grand has lost its glitter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Grand may possibly have been grander in the past, but now seems to have lost its glitter. Apart from the reception area, it has a generally tired and tatty appearance.
reviews.title: good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room was OK, but the bathroom was 1970s vintage, with no instructions on how to work the shower (which we eventually figured out ourselves). The aircon lacks grunt as the room was slow to cool down. There was construction noise next door at night, but I guess that is really not the hotel's fault.
reviews.title: Well worth the price

likes.liked: — Value for money..huge room for Asia
likes.disliked: — As with all Asian Hotels the beds are very firm

reviews.text: The breakfasts were mediocre in quality and quantity, the waiters need more training and at least some of them should speak English. Although breakfasts are supposed to be provided until 9am, you really need to get there before 8am as the food doesn't seem to be replenished after then. Don't bother eating any other meals there.
reviews.title: Grand Hotel in Saigon
